result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Jerell Marable Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC; balance paid during extended supervision. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence; credit for 258 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
- Full-time work, school or a combination.
- Obtain GED or HSED.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- No further violations of the law.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Jerell Marable Jr.

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing ( 31 pages) commencing 07-18-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Robert Jerell Marable in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Robert Jerell Marable in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
 Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and  filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 years, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 258 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 21 months, the term of extended supervision is 27 months. 

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Full time work, school or a combination. 
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

1343 Jury Instructions

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Robert Jerell Marable not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Case scheduled for final pretrial. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Robert Jerell Marable not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial. Defendant not produced. Case adjourned for in-person final pretrial, Branch 2  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

OFF THE RECORD
Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Robert Jerell Marable not in court, in custody, MSDF.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant awaiting revocation.  Discovery and offer under review.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ON THE RECORD
Called on the record with same appearances.  There is a pending prompt dispo with a deadline of 7.21.22

Filed: DNA Notice of Intent to Use.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 04-06-2022, by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Robert Jerell Marable in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Robert Jerell Marable in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of defendant's prior conviction regarding case # 19CF911. Sworn for the State: P.O. Maria Albiter - Wauwatosa PD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert Jerell Marable in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Robert Jerell Marable in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Jerell Marable appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
